newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kuehbacher says EMU definitely to start on time.
newsitem.headline: Kuehbacher says EMU definitely to start on time.

text.p: Bundesbank council member Klaus-Dieter Kuehbacher said on Thursday he believed European currency union would definitely start on time but that members should not be decided only on a political basis.
Kuehbacher, who is president of the regional state central bank of Berlin and Brandenberg, said in the text of a speech to business group in Berlin that EMU would definitely occur.
"I want to take the opportunity today to make very clear: Those who believe progress towards currency union can be stopped is ignoring the political reality," Kuehbacher said.
He said the push for a single European currency has reached the "so-called point of no return".
